meanings.definition: A small, rounded protuberance on a plant
meanings.sent1: The bouton on the leaf looked like a tiny bump.
meanings.sent2: I found a bouton growing on the stem of the flower.
meanings.sent3: The bouton on the plant seemed to be waving hello.
meanings.sent4: The bouton on the cactus was like a tiny green jewel.
meanings.sent5: The bouton on the tree was as round as a marble.

meanings.definition: A small, raised area on the skin, such as a pimple
meanings.sent1: She noticed a bouton on her cheek and applied some cream.
meanings.sent2: The bouton on his forehead was red and inflamed.
meanings.sent3: The bouton on his nose seemed to have a personality of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her bouton was like a tiny volcano ready to erupt.
meanings.sent5: The bouton on his chin was as stubborn as a mule.

meanings.definition: A button or knob on a piece of equipment or clothing
meanings.sent1: Press the bouton to turn on the machine.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a bouton onto the shirt for decoration.
meanings.sent3: The bouton on the remote control seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The bouton on the jacket was like a shiny little gem.
meanings.sent5: The bouton on the radio was as important as a key to a treasure chest.
